intro: Syngonanthus saxicola, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a small, mat-forming plant native to rocky habitats in arid regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, low-growing structure with small, succulent leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with features such as thick leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. Syngonanthus saxicola is often found in crevices and on rocky slopes, where it thrives in poor, well-drained soils.
